io.atomix.storage.buffer

Class UnsafeMappedBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.storage.buffer.AbstractBytes
      • io.atomix.storage.buffer.NativeBytes
        • io.atomix.storage.buffer.UnsafeMappedBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bytes, BytesInput<Bytes>, BytesOutput<Bytes>, AutoCloseable

    public class UnsafeMappedBytes
extends NativeBytes
    Mapped bytes.

    Mapped bytes provide direct access to memory from allocated by a MappedByteBuffer. Memory is allocated by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

    Closing the bytes via Bytes.close() will result in BytesOutput.flush() being automatically called.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static UnsafeMappedBytes allocate(File file,
                                         int size)
        Allocates a mapped buffer in FileChannel.MapMode#READ_WRITE mode.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than MappedMemory.MAX_SIZE
        See Also:
        allocate(File, FileChannel.MapMode, int)

      • allocate

        public static UnsafeMappedBytes allocate(File file,
                                         FileChannel.MapMode mode,
                                         int size)
        Allocates a mapped buffer.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        mode - The mode with which to map the file.
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than MappedMemory.MAX_SIZE
        See Also:
        allocate(File, int)
